etymologies: late 16th century: modern Latin, from Italian sorgo, perhaps based on a variant of Latin syricum ‘Syrian’

definitions: a widely cultivated cereal native to warm regions of the Old World. It is a major source of grain and of feed for livestock.

notes.text: Genus Sorghum, family Gramineae: many species, in particular S. bicolor and its cultivars

shortDefinitions: cereal which is native to warm regions of Old World

definitions: a syrupy sweetener made from a type of sorghum.
shortDefinitions: syrupy sweetener made from type of this cereal
